segments.speaker: IELTS_Examiner
segments.text: IELTS 18. Published by Cambridge University Press and Assessment, 2023. This recording is copyright. Test 1. This is the IELTS listening test. You will hear a number of different recordings and you will have to answer questions on what you hear. There will be time for you to read the instructions and questions and you will have a chance to check your work. All the recordings will be played once only. The test is in four parts. At the end of the test, you will be given 10 minutes to transfer your answers to an answer sheet. Now turn to part one. Part one. You will hear an interview with a woman who is doing a survey on transport. First, you have some time to look at questions one to five. Now listen carefully and answer questions 1 to 5.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: Excuse me, would you mind if I asked you some questions? We're doing a survey on transport. Yes, that's OK. First of all, can I take your name? Yes, it's Sadie Jones. Thanks very much. And could I have your date of birth? Just the year will do, actually. Is that all right?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Yes, that's fine. It's 1991.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: So, next, your postcode, please.

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: It's DW 30 7YZ.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: Great, thanks. Is that in Wells?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: No, it's actually in Harborne. Wells isn't far from there, though. I

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: really like that area. My grandmother lived there when I was a kid.

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Yes, it is nice.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: Right, so now I want to ask you some questions about how you travelled here today. Did you use public transport?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Yes, I came by bus.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: OK, and that was today. It's the 24th of April, isn't it?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Isn't it the 25th? Er, no. Actually, you're right.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: And what was the reason for your trip today? I can see you've got some shopping with you.

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Yes, I did some shopping. But the main reason I came here was to go to the dentist.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: That's not much fun. Hope it was nothing serious.

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: No, it was just a check-up. It's fine.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: Good. Do you normally travel by bus into the city centre?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Yes, I stopped driving in ages ago because parking was so difficult to find and it costs so much.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: I see.

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: The bus is much more convenient too. It only takes about 30 minutes.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: That's good. So where did you start your journey?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: At the bus stop on Claxby Street. Is that C-L-A-X-B-Y? That's right.

segments.speaker: IELTS_Examiner
segments.text: Before you hear the rest of the conversation, you have some time to look at questions 6 to 10. Now listen and answer questions six to ten.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: And how satisfied with the service are you? Do you have any complaints?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Well, as I said, it's very convenient and quick when it's on time. But this morning it was late. Only about ten minutes, but still.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: Yes, I understand that's annoying. And what about the timetable? Do you have any comments about that?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: I suppose I mainly use the bus during the day, but any time I've been in town in the evening, for dinner or at the cinema, I've noticed you have to wait a long time for a bus. There aren't that many. OK,

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: thanks. So now I'd like to ask you about your car use.

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Well, I have got a car, but I don't use it that often, mainly just to go to the supermarket. But that's about it, really. My husband uses it at the weekends to go to the golf club.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: And what about a bicycle?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: I don't actually have one at the moment.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: What about the city bikes you can rent? Do you ever use those?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: No, I'm not keen on cycling there because of all the pollution. But I would like to get a bike. It would be good to use it to get to work.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: So why haven't you got one now?

segments.speaker: Survey_Respondent
segments.text: Well, I live in a flat on the second floor and it doesn't have any storage. So we'd have to leave it in the hall outside the flat.

segments.speaker: Survey_Interviewer
segments.text: I see. OK, well, I think that's all we need from you

segments.speaker: IELTS_Examiner
segments.text: today. You now have one minute to check your answers to part one.
